exercises.title: Understanding Polypersonal Verbs
exercises.instructions: Choose the correct answer about polypersonal verbs and Georgian verb structure.

questions.question: What makes Georgian verbs 'polypersonal'?

options.text: They agree with the subject only
They simultaneously mark both the subject AND the object in one verb form
They are conjugated for number only

questions.explanation: Polypersonal verbs are verbs that mark both subject and object simultaneously within the verb itself, which is a distinctive feature of Georgian.

questions.question: In the verb ვხედავ [vkhedav], what does the prefix ვ- [v-] indicate?

options.text: The verb is in past tense

questions.explanation: The prefix ვ- [v-] marks first person singular subject (I) in Series I (Present/Future) conjugation.

questions.question: Which Series covers Present and Future tenses?
questions.explanation: Series I covers both Present and Future tenses in Georgian. Context determines which time frame is intended.

questions.question: How many verb classes does Georgian have?
questions.explanation: Georgian verbs are organized into four classes (I-IV) based on their grammatical behavior: Class I (Transitive), Class II (Intransitive), Class III (Medial), and Class IV (Indirect).

questions.question: Which sentence demonstrates a Class I (Transitive) verb?

options.text: მე წიგნს ვკითხულობ (I read the book)
მე მთაში ვარ (I am in the mountains)

questions.explanation: Class I verbs are transitive verbs that take a direct object. 'I read the book' has a direct object (book), making it Class I.

exercises.title: Match Verb Forms to Translations
exercises.instructions: Match the Georgian verb forms with their correct English translations.

questions.explanation: Remember the Series I conjugation pattern: ვ- [v-] marks first person, -ს [-s] marks third person, -თ [-t] or -ენ [-en] marks plural.

exercises.title: Identify Verb Parts
exercises.instructions: Analyze the Georgian verb forms and identify the subject markers.

questions.question: In the verb ვწერ [vts'er], what is the subject marker?
questions.explanation: The prefix ვ- [v-] marks first person singular (I) in Series I conjugation.

questions.question: In the verb ხედავს [khedavs], what is the subject marker?
questions.explanation: The suffix -ს [-s] marks third person singular (he/she/it) in Series I conjugation.

questions.question: Which marker indicates first person plural (we)?
questions.explanation: First person plural is marked by the combination of ვ- [v-] prefix and -თ [-t] suffix (e.g., ვხედავთ [vkhedavt] 'we see').

exercises.title: Series I Time Reference
exercises.instructions: Determine whether these Series I sentences are present or future tense based on context.

questions.question: დღეს ვმუშაობ [dgh'es vmushaob]. This sentence means:

options.text: I work today / I am working today (present)

questions.explanation: დღეს [dgh'es] means 'today,' which indicates present tense. In Georgian, Series I verbs express present tense when there's a present time marker.

questions.question: ხვალ მე ქართულად ვისწავლი [khval me kart'ulad vists'avli]. This sentence means:
questions.explanation: ხვალ [khval] means 'tomorrow,' which indicates future tense. In Georgian, Series I verbs express future tense when there's a future time marker.
